description_en: The Present Simple tense is used for habits, routines, general truths, facts, and permanent situations.
description_tr: Present Simple (Geniş Zaman), alışkanlıklar, rutinler, genel doğrular, gerçekler ve kalıcı durumlar için kullanılır.
objectives: Learn affirmative, negative and question forms with all subjects.
Understand when to use 'do' and 'does'.
Practice spelling rules for third person singular (he/she/it).
Learn adverbs of frequency (always, often, usually, never).
Practice short answers.

affirmative.en_pattern: Subject + base verb (+ s/es for he/she/it).

examples.en: I play football.
She works in a bank.
They live in Istanbul.

spelling_rules_3rd_person: Fiil + y → consonant + y → y → ies → study → studies (ama: play → plays)

examples.en: I don't like tea.
He doesn't go to school on Sundays.
We don't watch TV in the morning.
Do you speak English?
Does she play the piano?
Do they live here?

habits_routines.en: I wake up at 7 o'clock every day.
She usually goes to the gym.

general_truths.en: The sun rises in the east.

examples.en: I read books.
She drinks tea every morning.
They play football at weekends.
We don't eat meat.
He doesn't watch TV.
Do you go to school?

lines.en: A: Do you like math?
B: No, I don't. I like English.
A: What time do you wake up?
B: I wake up at 7 o'clock.

items.a: He doesn't play football at weekends.

description_en: The Present Continuous tense is used for actions happening now, temporary situations, and near future plans.
description_tr: Present Continuous (Şimdiki Zaman), şu anda gerçekleşen eylemler, geçici durumlar ve yakın gelecek planları için kullanılır.
objectives: Learn affirmative, negative and question forms.
Use the '-ing' form of verbs correctly.
Understand the difference between 'now' and 'every day' (Present Simple vs Present Continuous).
Learn time expressions used with Present Continuous.

examples.en: I am studying.
She is playing the guitar.
They are watching TV.
I am not sleeping.
He is not working today.
We are not playing football.
Are you listening?
Is she reading a book?
Am I speaking too fast?

temporary_situations.en: He is living in London this year.
We are staying at a hotel.

near_future_plans.en: I am meeting my friend tomorrow.
They are traveling to Italy next week.

spelling_rules_ing: Most verbs: play → playing, read → reading
Verbs ending with -e: make → making, write → writing
One vowel + one consonant: run → running, sit → sitting
Verbs ending with -ie: lie → lying, die → dying

examples.en: I am drinking water.
We are studying English.
She is not listening.
Are they playing basketball?

lines.en: A: What are you doing?
B: I am watching TV.
A: Is she studying?
B: No, she isn’t. She is listening to music.
lines.tr: B: Hayır, çalışmıyor. O müzik dinliyor.

mini_test.score_note_tr: Her doğru cevap 1 puan, toplam 5 puan.

description_en: The Past Simple tense is used for finished actions in the past, completed events, and past habits.
description_tr: Past Simple (Geçmiş Zaman), geçmişte tamamlanmış eylemler, olaylar ve geçmiş alışkanlıklar için kullanılır.
objectives: Learn regular and irregular verb forms.
Use affirmative, negative and question structures.
Understand the difference between 'did' and V2.
Practice time expressions for past tense.

affirmative.pattern: Subject + V2 (past form of the verb)

examples.en: I watched a movie yesterday.
She went to school.
They played football.
I didn’t watch TV.
He didn’t go to the party.
We didn’t play tennis.
Did you go to school?
Did she watch the film?
Did they play football?

finished_actions.en: I visited my grandmother last week.

past_habits.en: When I was a child, I played outside every day.

time_expressions: ago (two days ago, three years ago)
regular_verbs_rule: Sessiz + y → y → ied → study → studied
Düzensiz fiiller (irregular verbs) farklı: go → went, see → saw

common_mistakes.tr_note: Past Simple’da fiil geçmiş zaman alır.

examples.en: I visited London last year.
She studied for the exam.
We didn’t play football yesterday.
Did you call your friend?

lines.en: A: Did you watch the movie?

description_en: The Past Continuous tense is used for actions that were in progress at a specific time in the past, interrupted actions, and background descriptions.
description_tr: Past Continuous (Şimdiki Zamanın Hikayesi), geçmişte belirli bir anda devam eden eylemler, başka bir olay tarafından kesilen eylemler ve arka plan betimlemeleri için kullanılır.
objectives: Learn how to form Past Continuous with was/were + V-ing.
Differentiate between Past Simple and Past Continuous.
Use time expressions with Past Continuous.
Practice with interrupted actions and background descriptions.

examples.en: I was reading a book at 8 o’clock.
She was cooking dinner.
They were playing football yesterday evening.
I wasn’t sleeping at 10.
He wasn’t working yesterday afternoon.
We weren’t watching TV.
Were you studying last night?
Was she sleeping at 11?
Were they playing football?

action_in_progress.tr: Onlar bütün öğleden sonra ders çalışıyorlardı.

interrupted_actions.en: I was reading when the phone rang.
She was cooking when her friend arrived.

background_description.en: The birds were singing and the sun was shining.

description_en: The Present Perfect tense connects the past with the present. It is used for experiences, actions that started in the past and continue now, and actions with present results.
description_tr: Present Perfect (Yakın Geçmiş Zaman), geçmiş ile şimdiki zamanı birbirine bağlar. Deneyimler, geçmişte başlayıp hala devam eden eylemler ve sonucu şu anda görülen eylemler için kullanılır.
objectives: Learn the structure of have/has + V3.
Differentiate between Present Perfect and Past Simple.
Use Present Perfect with time expressions (already, yet, just, ever, never, since, for).
Practice affirmative, negative and interrogative forms.

examples.en: I have visited London.
She has finished her homework.
They have lived here for 10 years.
I haven’t seen that movie.
He hasn’t finished his work.
We haven’t eaten yet.
Have you ever been to Paris?
Has she called you?
Have they finished the project?

recent_actions_with_results.en: I have just finished my homework.

topic: Present Perfect Continuous Tense (have/has + been + V-ing)
description_en: The Present Perfect Continuous is used to show that an action started in the past and is still continuing, or that it has recently stopped but its effects are still visible.
description_tr: Present Perfect Continuous (Yakın Geçmişte Devam Eden Zaman), geçmişte başlayıp halen devam eden veya yeni bitmiş ama etkisi halen görülen eylemler için kullanılır.
objectives: Learn the structure have/has + been + V-ing.
Use Present Perfect Continuous for ongoing actions.
Differentiate between Present Perfect and Present Perfect Continuous.
Practice with time expressions like for, since, all day.

examples.en: I have been studying for two hours.
She has been working since morning.
They have been playing football all day.
I haven’t been sleeping well lately.
He hasn’t been studying enough.
We haven’t been waiting for long.
Have you been reading this book?
Has she been working here for long?
examples.tr: O uzun zamandır burada mı çalışıyor?

examples.en: Have they been studying all night?
examples.tr: Onlar bütün gece ders mi çalışıyorlar?

action_continuing_now.en: I have been learning English for 3 years.
She has been working here since 2020.

recent_actions_with_results.en: I am tired because I have been running.
Her hands are dirty because she has been painting.

temporary_actions.en: They have been staying with us for a week.

common_mistakes.wrong: I have been knowing him for years.
common_mistakes.right: I have known him for years.
common_mistakes.tr_note: Stative fiiller (know, like, love) Continuous ile kullanılmaz.

examples.en: We have been working on this project for months.
He hasn’t been feeling well lately.
Have you been exercising recently?

B: For three years.

description_en: The Past Perfect tense is used to describe an action that happened before another action or point in the past. It shows the sequence of past events.
description_tr: Past Perfect (Mișli Geçmiş Zaman), geçmişteki iki olaydan önce gerçekleşmiş olanı anlatmak için kullanılır. Olayların sırasını gösterir.
objectives: Learn the structure had + V3.
Use Past Perfect to show the order of past events.
Differentiate Past Perfect from Past Simple.
Practice affirmative, negative and interrogative forms.
Use time expressions like before, after, already, just, by the time.

examples.en: I had finished my homework before dinner.

experience_before_past.en: They had already visited the museum before it closed.
experience_before_past.tr: Müze kapanmadan önce çoktan ziyaret etmişlerdi.

common_mistakes.wrong: I had went home before dinner.
common_mistakes.right: I had gone home before dinner.

topic: Past Perfect Continuous Tense (had + been + V-ing)
description_en: The Past Perfect Continuous tense is used to show that an action was ongoing over a period of time before another action or point in the past.
description_tr: Past Perfect Continuous (Mișli Yakın Geçmiş Zaman), geçmişteki bir noktadan önce bir süredir devam eden eylemleri anlatmak için kullanılır.
objectives: Learn the structure had + been + V-ing.
Use Past Perfect Continuous to describe actions that were ongoing before a past event.
Differentiate between Past Perfect and Past Perfect Continuous.
Practice affirmative, negative and interrogative forms.
Use time expressions like for, since, all day, by the time.

examples.en: I had been studying for two hours before she arrived.
examples.tr: O gelmeden önce iki saattir ders çalışıyordum.

examples.en: They had been playing football all morning before it started raining.
examples.tr: Yağmur başlamadan önce bütün sabah futbol oynuyorlardı.

topic: Future Tenses (will / going to / Present Continuous for future)
description_en: Future tenses are used to talk about events that will happen later. 'Will' expresses decisions or predictions, 'going to' expresses plans or intentions, and Present Continuous is used for fixed arrangements.
description_tr: Gelecek zamanlar, gelecekte olacak olayları anlatmak için kullanılır. 'Will' kararlar veya tahminler için, 'going to' planlar veya niyetler için, Present Continuous ise kesin planlar için kullanılır.
objectives: Learn affirmative, negative, and question forms of all future tenses.
Differentiate 'will', 'going to', and Present Continuous for future.
Use time expressions like tomorrow, next week, soon, in 5 minutes.
Practice short answers.
Understand common mistakes and how to correct them.

examples.en: I will call you tomorrow.
She will be happy.

going_to.pattern: Subject + am/is/are + going to + base verb

examples.en: I am going to start a new course.
They are going to travel next month.

going_to.negative: Subject + am/is/are + not + going to + base verb
going_to.questions: Am/Is/Are + subject + going to + base verb?

examples.en: I am meeting my friend tomorrow.
She is leaving at 6 pm.

going_to.en: I am going to visit my grandparents next week.

common_mistakes.tr_note: Present Continuous yapısı için verb-ing gerekir.

description_en: Future Continuous describes ongoing actions at a specific future time, while Future Perfect shows that an action will be completed before a certain future time.
description_tr: Future Continuous, belirli bir gelecekte devam eden eylemleri gösterir; Future Perfect ise bir eylemin belirli bir zamana kadar tamamlanacağını ifade eder.
objectives: Understand forms of Future Continuous and Future Perfect.
Learn affirmative, negative, and question structures.
Use time expressions like at 8 pm, by next week, in two hours.
Distinguish between continuous and perfect future usage.
Practice short answers and predictions.
